message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DL. 

This paper deals with text classification using word embeddings and deep learning techniques, which are commonly used in natural language processing (NLP) and information retrieval (IR) tasks. Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) and cs.IR (Information Retrieval) are the most likely sub-categories. Additionally, the paper proposes a novel semantic similarity measure, which involves modeling word embeddings and category vectors, indicating the use of machine learning and deep learning techniques, which are also relevant to cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Finally, the paper mentions the state-of-the-art techniques, which are often based on deep learning models, indicating the relevance to cs.DL (Deep Learning).
